title: Williamson to Walt Whitman, 8 Nov 1868
text: Nov the 8th 68 Dear Driend Walt It has been along time since I have heard from you so I thought that I would write you aline and let you know that I am well and enjoying good health and I hope that you may receive the same Blessing I have writen[written] to you three before but have received no answer. Now Walt I have not forgoten[forgotten] you. I look at the picture I fancy that it looks just like you every time I look at if I wish you are here that I might shake hands with you I &cif you get this I think you will write to meWell Walt I must tell you the news nothine[nothing] so very new. Walt on the 19th day of augAugust last I took A pardner for life. She proves very kind to me so far and I trust that She will tide out. Walt I dont say much about Edition so adont[I don't] think of much to write as this makes the third that I write to your one. & so good luck to you if we never see each others face again but trust to providence. I will draw to a close so good by[bye].Address Williamson Wayne CoN. Y.Walt WhitmanWashington D.C. Williamson to Walt Whitman, 8 Nov 1868
